comment.author: 48982730@N00
comment._content:
Wow, I've never seen the building as an actual store.

This is taken from Museum Station, I'd say.

comment.author: 40765792@N00
comment._content: I remember shopping here with my Grandmother! Such a pretty building.

comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content: This building is now home to the Local Court in Sydney and some criminal District Courts. Which is a little bizarre. -- Seen on your photo stream. (?)

comment.author: 34205733@N05
comment._content: my grandmother would take me shopping in the late 50's to Mark Foys and Anthony Horderns. She told me that Mark Foys was patronised by the more well to do residents of Sydney.

comment.author: 22743973@N08
comment._content: Lovely old building, I like the corner towers with their tall roofs and the dormer windows. Nice find and photo.

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: On the side of the building "G VI R - Long may he reign".  King George VI (the current Queen's father) ascended to the throne on 11 December 1936. So this picture may be Christmas 1936???

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Yes thanks GrenadierGuardsDmr, the coronation was 12 May 1937
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
